children.text: There has not been jack studs installed within 300mm of the nominated brickwork articulation joints (AJ’s) to properly tie the brickwork into above and below the window frames.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3700 requires in section 4.10 Wall Ties, that

‘Wall ties for cavity walls and masonry veneer walls shall be spaced not greater than 600mm in each direction. Adjacent to horizontal and vertical lateral supports and control joints, and around openings in the masonry, with the first line of ties located within 300mm from the line of lateral support, the control joint or the perimeter of opening’ .
Additional jack studs must be installed so the brickwork can be tied into the frame within 300mm of the articulation joints in accordance with AS 3700.
